attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -34.25loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +60 pieces

All other materials had either zero or negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: + Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           Strong internal controls will be maintained.
Control is ok and will maintain the trend
+ Previous audit stocks showed minimal item variation.
Previous

·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 06.06.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal item variation noted means proper internal controls.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Dough weights:

·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 07/006/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 07.06.2025:(2 shift @04.50pm)

ü  Dough weights showed high overweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: + High dough weight rate should be addressed.
attributes.effect: + Over and underweight dough samples imply set standard dough weights were not adhered to. These would result to bread weight extreme weights.

value: + We will sensitize dough dividers to ensure that set dough dividing weights are adhered to.
+ Dough dividers will be educated on the importance of adhering to set dough dividing weights.
+ Several over and underweight dough pices were noted during previous audit dough sampling.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Dough weights extremes noted show non compliance to set dough dividing weights which is a precipitate of over and underweight bread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that dough weights set are adhered to in order to produce standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
1)      Packed bread weight:

·         Bread weights were sampled on 06/06/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation:
Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread. 

Noted bread weight extremes should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
+ ·         High dough weights would result to overweight bread production.

·         Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing as justified by dough  weights sampled.

·         Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenue targets.

Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

value:
·         The underweight and overweight bread problem majorly arises during molding, where pieces of molded bread get into contact with each other on the dividing table and consequently increase or decrease the initial dividing weights.

High overweight bread rate will however be addressed,
More controls on weight will be put to address the observed overweight loaves.
+ Previous audit bread weight check showed bread weight extremes.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of  packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High overweight bread was noted and hence noncompliance to set standard weights.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/05/2025 - 31/05/2025.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

·          Control of market damages is commendable.
attributes.effect: High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.

value: Strict adherence to the production process will be implemented to reduce the high percentage of production damages.

Noted high production damages will be addressed.

We had deformed 800g baking tins which caused damages but have been replaced and we expect reduction in bread damages.
April 2025 audit report highlighted high production damages rate as analyzed from 01.03.25 – 31.03.25.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ High production damages were noted hence showing noncompliance to set tolerable production damages levels. This negatively affects revenue targets.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that bread damages are within the tolerable rates.

attributes.title: Broken bread damages (sent to ingredients)-Analysis
attributes.description:
·           As per the records, there was 537.9 kg of bread damages that was to be sent to ingredients department.

·           A total of 0kg was sent over the same period hence the expected physical balance was 537.9kg.

·           On the spot-check day 530.8kg of bread damages was found giving a variance of -7.1kg (-17.75 loaves).

 Below is a summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·           The branch management should ensure that all bread damages are properly accounted for as observed.
attributes.effect: + Minimal variance noted implies there was accountability of bread damages.

value: We will always ensure control of bread damages.
Broken bread damages sent to ingredient department will always be properly managed.
+ Broken bread damages were accounted for as per April 2025 audit report.
Previous

·           Bread damages recorded from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 was compared with the damages sent and the physical damages in the branch to identify if the branch accounted for all bread damages.

As per the records, there was 537.9 kg of bread damages that was to be sent to ingredients department.
+ Broken bread damages destined for the ingredients department were accounted for as per the company policy.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring accountability of broken bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

01.05.25 – 31.05.25:

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
We will strengthen document accuracy to ensure that accurate information is conveyed on registers and SAP system.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted that raw material quantity on mixing charts was accurately reflected on SAP system.
Previous
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.05.25 – 31.05.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Production data was accurately transferred hence proper accountability,
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that production data on source documents (mixing charts/summaries) is accurately transferred to SAP system this would mean accountability of raw materials and finished products.

Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.
attributes.effect: Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.

value: Proper cash control will be maintained.
This trend will be maintained.
Physical cash verification on 13.04.25 showed minimal cash verification.
Previous
·           A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Cash at the branch was properly managed and accounted for.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring cash at the branch is accounted for.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 06.06.2025.

attributes.recommendation: The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the noted good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: Minishop SOPs are adhered to.

value: We shall maintain control at the mini shop.
Controls on mini shop to be maintained.

Sales Department

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 01/05/2024 – 31/05/2025, aggregate yield (after conversion to 400g) ranged from 191.12 – 191.265lvs/bag, with an average of 192.19lvs/bag.

·          From 5,870bags, total yield expected was 1,122,302pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 1,122,302pcs was reflected on production records. Thus expected yields realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: Noted realization of yield targets is commendable.
attributes.effect: Revenue targets were realized.

value: We will ensure set yields are always produced and recorded.
We will maintain this trend.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted that set standard yields were achieved at the branch as analyzed from 10.03.25 - 12.04.25.
Previous

The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Set standard bread yields as per set BOM were realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set standard bread yields are achieved.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description: ·          Analysis was done from 01/05/2025 - 31/05/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard production efficiency is maintained as observed.
attributes.effect: + Achieving set production efficiency checked production costs.

value: + We will mainatin production efficiency as per required.
+ We will keep on stressing on maintaining set standard production efficiency.
April 2025 audit report highlighted that set standard production efficiency was realized as analyzed from 10.03.25 - 11.04.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Set standard production efficiency was realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set standard production efficiency is achieved.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description: ·          Packing efficiency (01/05/2025 – 31/05/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          Branch management should ensure proper planning is put in place to ensure set standard packing efficiency is realized.

·          Surplus payments due to packing inefficiency should be surcharged.
attributes.effect: Packing inefficiency increased production costs.

value:
·          We will put in necessary measures to address packing inefficiency.

Bakery workers in slicing section to be strictly supervised for an improved efficiency going forward.
Noted Packing inefficiency will be addressed.
April 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency which cost the company Kshs. 30,304.00 as analyzed from 10.03.25 - 11.04.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·         Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Set standard packing efficiency of 97crates/packer was not achieved hence noncompliance.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set standard packing efficiency are achieved.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table
attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Economical fuel consumption checks operations costs.

value: Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
·          We will maintain the observed trend.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted economical fuel consumption by sales vans.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption by sales vans was as per expected and in line with the company policy.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel consumption by sales vans is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
Generator fuel consumption.

·           Generator fuel consumption from 06/03/2025 – 06/06/2025.

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

GENERATOR : (06/03/25 - 06/06/25)
attributes.recommendation: + Generator standard fuel consumption rate should be provided to enable monitoring of fuel usage and flag any fluctuations.
attributes.effect: + Fuel consumption by the generator could not be determined and cases of overconsumption become hard to flag since the generator has no set standard fuel consumption rate.

value: + We only request for required fuel to fill the generator and upon purchasing well fill all purchased fuel and retain no fuel balance on jerricans.
+ We will liaise with KAF to get the standard fuel consumption for the generator.
+ April 2025 audit highlighted that the generator had no set standard fuel consumption rate.
Previous

·            The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by generator was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ The generator has no set standard fuel consumption rate hence hard to determine under or over consumption of fuel.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring generator fuel consumption is economical.

attributes.title: Outstanding customer debts
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs. 307,814.80.
attributes.recommendation: ·         Sales crew and the sales representative to ensure that bread supplied is paid for on delivery for customers without credit arrangement.
attributes.effect: + High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.

value:
Regional sales Representative.

·         Turnboy vanished with cash collections for Bondo, Kodiaga and Luanda route and the issue was escalated.

·         Follow ups to be made and deductions raised where necessary.

Lolwe route customer (Ms. Christine) has a credit limit of Kshs. 300,000.00.

Regional sales Representative.

·         Turnboy vanished with cash collections for Bondo, Kodiaga and Luanda route and the issue was escalated.

·         Follow ups to be made and deductions raised where necessary.

Lolwe route customer (Ms. Christine) has a credit limit of Kshs. 300,000.00.
·         In the previous audit, outstanding debts for customers was Kshs. 505,048.00.
Previous
·         Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 6th June 2025 for routes was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding customer debts was noted which was against company policy.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring that no customer outstanding balances for bread supplies made.
